intro: Lunasia quercifolia var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf lunasia, is a variant of the lunasia plant characterized by its lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is native to certain regions of North America. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. The flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, which is a common feature among members of its family.
